title: (x) Ajiyoshiya Japanese restaurant logo - hand lettered (similar to Papyrus {Patricia}
content:
Hi there,

[WhatTheFont](http://web.archive.org/myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/) couldn't tell me. Maybe real human eyes know.

Any ideas?

Thanks in advance,

Amy

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ajiyoshiya.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041301/http:/typophile.com/files/ajiyoshiya.jpg) | 67.39 KB |
author: abecedarienne

comments.content:
Papyrus

Hmm... close but no cigar.

On second look I think it was hand painted - the A's don't quite match. You can certainly get awfully close with Papyrus.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/papyrus/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041301/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/papyrus/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/papyrus/")

I sure say this i is handpainted. A's are not identical. Neither are the Y's. It could by a retailfont with a rough brush stroke in illustrator, but in that case i'm no help.

Benjamin
